title: WHy do mids take ghost now
body: took ghost because everyone else takes it now and fed my ass off smh

replies.body:
1) it's not fucking season 3 anymore, we are in season 7 and deathfire grasp is long gone
1a) it's not season 3 anymore
2) mid lane meta shifted from "pew pew zed/ahri poke and all ins" towards "afk farm into mid-late game" (THIS DOESN'T MEANS ASSASSINS ARE NOT VIABLE ANYMORE, let's make this clear)
3) at lv7 you unlock your waveclear, so it means that you have to push otherwise you don't apply map pressure
4) ghost cd got reduced quite a lot
5) it helps you position during a teamfight, assuming you know what that means and you don't just ram your head into the enemy and then cry "noob team" when you all die
5a) it helps you set up your crowd controls better, as you can chase targets and they can't escape you
5b) you can walk back and wait for cooldowns when you used your full combo and all you have left are your 50 damage mid laner autoattacks
5c) you can angle your skillshots/CCs better or constantly walk in and out enemy ranges so you can fight more efficiently and safer

So, your mid lane summoners's spell choices comes down to this

{{summoner:14}} You are an assassin and/or you have a lot of kill potential
{{summoner:6}} all the boring stuff i said before, but hey! you don't need it you deserve challenjour, knowledge is for nerd losers.
{{summoner:21}} you need to save your ass from a burst damage that otherwise will get you killed
{{summoner:7}} same as barrier but this is more sustained damage oriented (what is sustained damage? language is an option here...)
{{summoner:3}} you need to turn an all in in your favor, by either winning it or evening it out
{{summoner:12}} you just want to have a safe lane phase, splitpush like a madman, apply map pressure (assuming you know what that is)
{{summoner:1}} PFFFFT, don't even bother, this is when you need to save yourself from a barrage of CCs, but since you suck and you won't use it properly and the enemy sucks as well and won't be able to hit a single spell unless you stand still or walk into it, not even worth mentioning.

Oh and by the way, everything everybody said below is trivial and/or wrong, congrats.
And 2 dorans ring refund most costs of a waveclear, you might consider it when you don't get your blue and you're 170 cs at 30 minutes because you refused to press buttons on a wave for some reason.

Please spread this information to all your challenger friends since they didn't managed to figure this out on their own, it sickens me seeing headless chickens run around the map in my games.
